definition: many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
power/influence/potential/momentum/tendency/trend/situation/conditions/outward appearance/sign/gesture/male genitals
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives
many/numerous/crowd/multitude
variant of 眾|众[zhong4]

sentences.english: Overwhelm with numerical strength demand, blame, shouting.
sentences.chinese: 人多势众的需求，责备，叫骂。

sentences.english: That safety-in-numbers logic ought to keep Italy from trouble, too.
sentences.chinese: 人多势众的逻辑也应该确保意大利免受灾难。

sentences.english: Seeing that the enemy were many, they ran away.
sentences.chinese: 看到敌人人多势众，他们抱头鼠窜了。

sentences.english: But the clippers had had plenty of crew.
sentences.chinese: 不同的是三桅帆船人多势众。

sentences.english: Under the other large, small and strong home was caught by the killers.
sentences.chinese: 在对方人多势众下，小嘉与家强终被凶徒抓住。

definition: the few are no match for the many/heavily outnumbered/facing impossible odds (idiom)
multitude of enemies, few friends (idiom from Mencius)/heavily outnumbered/beaten by the weight of numbers
intrepid/valiant/dauntless
lit. strong soldiers and sturdy horses (idiom)/fig. a well-trained and powerful army
lit. strong dragon cannot repress a snake (idiom); fig. a local gangster who is above the law
pinyin: qiang2 long2 bu4 ya1 di4 tou2 she2

definition: brave
a wise man knows better than to fight when the odds are against him (idiom)
pinyin: hao3 han4 bu4 chi1 yan3 qian2 kui1

definition: attack from two sides/pincer movement/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
local bully/tyrant/regional mafia boss
to invade one's territory
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
to swarm around/flocking (to see)
mob
the whole nest came out (idiom); to turn out in full strength
to beat comfortably/to win easily/abbr. for 穩操勝券|稳操胜券, to have victory within one's grasp
lit. to refrain from shooting at the rat for fear of breaking the vases (idiom)/to not act against an evil so as to prevent harm to innocents
